parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per identified tumor per subject per assessor

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: TUSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Can be used to group split or merged tumors/lesions which have been identified.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: TUGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external identifier, such as a medical image ID number.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: TUREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: TUSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TULNKID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment results (in TR domain) over the course of the study.
datasetVariables.label: Link ID
datasetVariables.name: TULNKID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TULNKGRP

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
datasetVariables.label: Link Group ID
datasetVariables.name: TULNKGRP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96784

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the TEST in TUTEST. TUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters nor can start with a number. TUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "TUMIDENT". See TU Assumption 3.
datasetVariables.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Short Name
datasetVariables.name: TUTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96783

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test for the tumor/lesion identification. The value in TUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Tumor Identification". See TU Assumption 3.
datasetVariables.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Test Name
datasetVariables.name: TUTEST

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUORRES

datasetVariables.description: Result of the tumor/lesion identification. The result of tumor/lesion identification is a classification of the identified tumor/lesion. Examples: When TUTESTCD = "TUMIDENT", values of TUORRES might be "TARGET", "NON-TARGET", "NEW", or "BENIGN ABNORMALITY".
datasetVariables.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Result
datasetVariables.name: TUORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C123650

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from TUORRES in a standard format.
datasetVariables.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Result Std. Format
datasetVariables.name: TUSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUNAM

datasetVariables.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the tumor/lesion Identification. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
datasetVariables.name: TUNAM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TULOC

datasetVariables.description:
Used to specify the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion, e.g., "LIVER"
Note: When anatomical location is broken down and collected as distinct pieces of data that when combined provide the overall location information (e.g., laterality/directionality/distribution), then the additional anatomical location qualifiers should be used. See Assumption 3.
datasetVariables.label: Location of the Tumor/Lesion
datasetVariables.name: TULOC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TULAT

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality, for example, "LEFT", "RIGHT", "BILATERAL".
datasetVariables.label: Laterality
datasetVariables.name: TULAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUDIR

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality, for example, "UPPER", "INTERIOR".
datasetVariables.label: Directionality
datasetVariables.name: TUDIR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUPORTOT

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, or apportioning of. Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MULTIPLE".
datasetVariables.label: Portion or Totality
datasetVariables.name: TUPORTOT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method used to identify the tumor/lesion. Examples: "MRI", "CT SCAN".
datasetVariables.label: Method of Identification
datasetVariables.name: TUMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TULOBXFL

datasetVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: TULOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that TUBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: TUBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUEVAL

datasetVariables.description:
Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR".
This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from one or more independent assessors is included. For example, the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: TUEVAL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUEVALID

datasetVariables.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See TU Assumption 8.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: TUEVALID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUACPTFL

datasetVariables.description: In cases where more than one independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE") provide independent assessments at the same time point, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted assessment.
datasetVariables.label: Accepted Record Flag
datasetVariables.name: TUACPTFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Order of Element Within Arm

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TAETORD

self.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

datasetVariables.description: Number that gives the planned order of the Element within the Arm for the Element in which the assessment was made.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
datasetVariables.name: TAETORD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99079

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.EPOCH

datasetVariables.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUDTC

datasetVariables.description: TUDTC variable represents the date of the scan/image/physical exam. TUDTC does not represent the date that the image was read to identify tumors. TUDTC also does not represent the VISIT date.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Tumor/Lesion Identification
datasetVariables.name: TUDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TU.TUDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the scan/image/physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Tumor/Lesion Identification
datasetVariables.name: TUDY

description: A findings domain that represents data that uniquely identifies tumors or lesions under study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C106577, 2018-06-29)
label: Tumor/Lesion Identification
name: TU
